jsocket.datagram

Interface Datagram

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    ObjectDatagram, StringDatagram
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    DatagramImpl, ObjectDatagramImpl, StringDatagramImpl

    public interface Datagram
    Wraps a DatagramSocket and simply sends and receives DatagramPacket Base interface of this subpackage Lowest level in abstraction.
    Version:
    0.1.0
    Author:
    Will Czifro

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void close()
      Closes connection.
      java.net.InetAddress getDefaultInetAddress()
      Gets the default InetAddress that packets are being sent to
      int getDefaultPort()
      Gets the default port that packets are being sent on
      java.net.InetAddress getReceivedInetAddress()
      Gets the InetAddress of last received packet
      int getReceivedPort()
      Gets the port of last received packet
      byte[] receive()
      Receives raw packet and returns only the body of the packet
      java.net.DatagramPacket receivePacket()
      Receives the raw packet
      void send(byte[] data)
      This will wrap raw bytes with DatagramPacket Uses InetAddress and port from setDefaultInetAddressAndPort(InetAddress,int)
      void send(byte[] data, java.net.InetAddress address, int port)
      Wraps bytes with DatagramPacket This will send packet to specified InetAddress on specified port
      void send(java.net.DatagramPacket packet)
      This will simply send the DatagramPacket It is assumed that the packet is ready to send
      void setBufferSize(int bufferSize)
      Sets the default buffer size for receiving data
      void setDefaultInetAddressAndPort(java.net.InetAddress address, int port)
      Sets default InetAddress and port that packets will be sent to.
      void setTimeout(int timeout)
      Allows for a timeout to be set on read ops

      • setDefaultInetAddressAndPort

        void setDefaultInetAddressAndPort(java.net.InetAddress address,
                                  int port)
        Sets default InetAddress and port that packets will be sent to. Allows for simple call to send(byte[])
        Parameters:
        address - InetAddress default address
        port - int default port

      • setBufferSize

        void setBufferSize(int bufferSize)
        Sets the default buffer size for receiving data
        Parameters:
        bufferSize - size of default buffer

      • setTimeout

        void setTimeout(int timeout)
        Allows for a timeout to be set on read ops
        Parameters:
        timeout - duration to wait for packet

      • send

        void send(byte[] data)
        This will wrap raw bytes with DatagramPacket Uses InetAddress and port from setDefaultInetAddressAndPort(InetAddress,int)
        Parameters:
        data -

      • send

        void send(byte[] data,
          java.net.InetAddress address,
          int port)
        Wraps bytes with DatagramPacket This will send packet to specified InetAddress on specified port
        Parameters:
        data - byte[] data to send
        address - InetAddress address to send to
        port - int port to send on

      • send

        void send(java.net.DatagramPacket packet)
        This will simply send the DatagramPacket It is assumed that the packet is ready to send
